ext_description.p: A Product is the identification of a product or of a type of product. It is a collector of data common to all revisions of the Product.
ext_description.example: The SS Titanic is a product that could be represented by the entity data type Product.
Lifeboat is a class of products that could be represented by the entity data type Product. Each lifeboat on the SS Titanic is a member of this class.
ext_description.note: A product is identified by an organization or a person in an organization. The definition of the domain of uniqueness and the mechanism for guaranteeing the uniqueness of product id are outside the scope of this application module.
A product may have zero or more versions. A version of a product is represented with an instance of the entity Product_version or of one of its specializations.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the identifier that distinguishes the product. A particular codification for the values of this attribute may be specified in the EXPRESS schemas that use or specialize this entity, or in an agreement of common understanding between the partners sharing this information.
Part numbers, stock item numbers, and serial numbers are examples of product identifiers.
the words by which the product is known.
the text which describes the product. The value of the attribute need not be specified.

ext_description.p: A Product_category_assignment is the inclusion of one or more products in a product category.
ext_description.note: Usually, products are classified in categories of products. However, at some early phase of design, a product may not yet be categorized.
ext_description.example: A product may belong to categories named 'part', 'raw material', 'document', 'functionality', or 'requirement'.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The Product_category that contains the products.
The instances of Product which identify members of the product category.

The types_of_product function returns the set of product category names associated with the argument. The function evaluates the bag of instances of Product_category that are associated with the input Product through an instance of Product_category_assignment. The function returns the SET of STRING values stored in the name attribute of the instances of Product_category in the bag.
(input) the Product whose categories are considered.
